pageTitle: Patent US6471721 - Vascular stent having increased radiopacity and method for making same - Google Patents
textBeforeTable: Patent Citations While a particular form of the invention has been illustrated and described, it will also be apparent to those skilled in the art that various modifications can be made without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention. More specifically, it should be clear that the present invention is not limited to tubular type stents nor is it limited to any particular method of forming the underlying stent structure. Additionally, the invention is not limited to the use of any particular materials in either the core, radiopaque coating or encapsulating layer nor is it intended to be limited to any particular coating or application method. Accordingly, it is not intended that the invention be limited except by the appended claims. An advantage of the stent, and the method for manufacture described above, lies in the resolution of the stent under fluoroscopy. As previously mentioned, the high resolution is due to the strategically placed radiopaque strips inserted into grooves formed in the stent. The benefits of the stent are immediately apparent in practice where a physician, who views the stent under fluoroscopy, will clearly see the size and location of the stent in the vessel of the patient. The clear view of the stent enables the physician to perform his function efficiently and safely without the worry of incorrectly approximating the size or location of the stent.
